content.label:
This game is so easily worth the price. I own it on the google play and the App Store and there have always been zero regrets. This game is so much fun, and easy to pick up and get sucked in. The graphics are very well done, the controls are easy and responsive and the challenge is always present!
I sincerely hope to see a sequel for Wayward Souls one day if not something similar! Fantastic game hands down and keep up the great work!
I spent seven dollars on a whim and it has turned out to be the best whim I ever have whimmed!!! Seriously though enjoyable gameplay and the retro graphics are on point.

This game lacks any sort of micro transactions. Once you pay for the game it‚Äôs your skill and wits that win the game for you. The music is beautiful and the graphics feel just oh so good, pixel artwork done right in a way that almost screams late SNES. Just a warning:this game does not hold your hand. You will die. Many times.

To the developer: I maintain exceedingly high standards for the games I 5 star, no micro transactions, quality translation, free of bugs. Games that I 5 star should be the quality standard for mobile games. Please continue the top quality work.

Honestly, the money spent on this game was some of the best money i‚Äôve ever spent in the app store. I was bored one day and decided to look up some RPG game in the app store and ended up spending the next couple of hours becoming immersed in the difficult but rewarding gameplay, compelling story, and beautifully eerie and retro soundtrack. The game possesses such elegance and nostalgic charm, it‚Äôs difficult not to enjoy it. Sure, it‚Äôs sure gotten my blood pumping at some parts and even made me rage quit at a few, but when moving through corridor after corridor, taking hit after hit, one must always keep in mind that it‚Äôs all about the journey in Wayward Souls. Each character is fine tuned to match a certain playing style and I love to alternate between them, and discover different ways to use their abilities on various enemies. And don‚Äôt even get me started on the enemies. This masterpiece boasts a sprawling bestiary the likes of which could go toe to toe with terraria itself. Coming across hostiles in their respective and beautifully designed areas always keeps me intrigued and alert. And on the areas, it‚Äôs always so refreshing and interesting when I discover a unique room in the keep, hallows, or catacombs that has extra loot, more mobs or even fragments of the story in the form or ghosts, notes, lecterns or mini-boss battles. All of these factors, paired with the soundtrack and smooth playability, create a dark and mysterious mood that pulls the player in and keeps them there, needing to find out the story of their characters as well as that of the cursed tower.
 The writing is great, animation & design; phenomenal, world building; immersive, playability; just difficult enough to keep the player wanting more. The hats? Spectacular! 

In a nutshell, you can tell how much care and work was put into this project by just three people at RocketCat, and I wish dearly that more people could see and enjoy it. A true masterpiece and a honorable tribute to the eighties dungeon crawler genre. 

May Dia grant you heath and prosperity! 

-A devoted fan
Easily best game on the AppStore have had this for years now and thought why I haven‚Äôt left a review yet good work ü¶Öü¶Öü¶Öü¶Öü¶Öü¶Öü¶Ö
bad game i ever played in my life. its hard ro control deal with enemies all kind of thins r too complicated i want ma money back

title.label: When will you update your mobile version?!!!

content.label: No Paladin update, no new content, enjoy your one star. It all this game deserves. It didn‚Äôt used to be that way but after the developer basically abandoned the mobile version, not much else to say. Thanks a whole hell of a lot. I used to love your games but not now.

‚ÄúFancy control scheme‚Äù - don‚Äôt buy it, controls
are the same as every other mobile game and awful.
Why did you delete mage gauntlet. I need answers.
No more

This game is one of the most fun and replayable games ive ever had for a phone. Each character plays differently with their own move sets and style. Its a tough roguelike but the character progression is there and no time ever feels lost. Super fun. 9/10

I DID have a glowing review of this game.... until now.

It seems that, even though iOS gamers were the ones that helped to finance the developers PC version of this game and have waited for about 3+ years for the promised Paladin update to drop, the developers have now said that it's not worth it to them to update this iOS version with all of the content that has been added to the Steam version. 
I don't want to say they 'stuck it' to their mobile gaming fans, but.... it's impossible for me not to feel a little betrayed.... 
Rocketcat has definitely shown ungratefulness to their iDevice buyers, and I highly doubt that I will be purchasing any copies of Wayward Souls for my friends, PC or iOS.... and as for future games, I'm definitely NOT going to be throwing any money at them from here on out. 

What a HUGE disappointment from what was one of my absolute favorite video game development teams of the last decade. 

I can no longer recommend any of their games to anyone.

I‚Äôve played this game off and on for a couple years, and I have no doubt this is one of the best games on the App Store. I think the paladin being added in would be a nice touch. And I would love to see some of the things in the pc version ported over. Such at the health fountains, teleports, and new areas. But all in all this game has been my best App Store purchase.

title.label: The best mobile game on iOS

content.label: This game freaking amazing.  It is a crime that it doesn‚Äôt get more exposure.  The gameplay is tough at first but as you play you‚Äôll see how finely tuned this game is to much your skills.  And above all, this game has more heart than anything I‚Äôve seen since Shovel Knight.

This is still my favorite game on ios and I Uninstalled it after waiting for years for the "paladin" update that never came.

What happened???

title.label: Love this game, hate the apple store.

content.label: I bought this game in like 2014-2015, if not for a photographic memory; I would have paid $7 for a game I already bought. Great game. GREAT SOUNDTRACK! 5/5

Its a wonderful work. The gameplay is hard but fair. Soundtrack is very nice and compelling to listen to. Not a game for those who are looking for a quick experience or easy gameplay. The story building elements used in the game are fantastic and just about everything involved in the gameplay builds a unique world worth expiriencing. Some neat references via hat system and comedic or interesting random events that further enhance your gameplay and the overall story. It can be frustrating when you get stumped at a certain part or certain enemies give you trouble and whem that happens I take a break for a while but I always want to come back and return refreshed to keep going and manage to figure out the enemy and keep progressing. Loads of hours sunk into it and theres still much more to be done. Definitely worthy of 5 stars.

I don‚Äôt usually fork out several dollars for an app, but I found this title in a reddit thread about good rpgs on ios, and it does not disappoint.

The gameplay is fine-tuned and complex.  The playability is very deep.  There isn‚Äôt a traditional plot per se, but the character backstories are delivered in bite-sized chunks in a way that creates a sense of mystery and suspense that‚Äôs almost as good as well-developed lore.

It‚Äôs a good classic rpg on ios, which is unfortunately extremely rare.  Well done.
He replay ability alone without any further updates would be worth it.  If they added more content to the game, it would blow my mind!  Good job!
Plz when you get a chance add paladin update :)
Gameplay was confusing and inconsistent. Controlling the characters was a pain. No music. I was unimpressed and wish I could get my money back.

If a game requires you to drag around for the control scheme, it should fit every screen. They have not updated it for iPhone X. What‚Äôs worse, their website provides a support email address for such inquiries that doesn‚Äôt exist.

Honestly, this would be a 5 star review if the game used my full screen. OR, if the fact that the game not using the full screen frequently means my character is unresponsive and dies. 

On second thought, this should be a 2 star review because this is a $7 app but maybe the dev will fix this.

I love the game but it doesnt fit the new iphone screens so my thumb leaves the game‚Äôs edge and I stop moving. Usually the game is too dark to notice the edge while focusing on playing

The game is very good, in my opinion one of the best phone games out there. My only complaint is the occasional ridiculously bad RNG (occasionally there‚Äôll just be a room with four times the regular amount of enemies in it). That doesn‚Äôt happen much though, so it‚Äôs really a minimal complaint.

When one plays Wayward Souls, one expects to die often - but that‚Äôs all part of its addictive thrill. Honestly, there‚Äôs not much more to say than that. With its beautiful art, complex characters, memorable music and thoughtful combat mechanics, it just nails each and every tenant of what can make great gaming so great.
Frustrating

I love the game! A combination of diablo and Castlevania type game, controls are smooth and it has the ability to use different skills adds tons of fun to the game! 
The reason I only gave 4 stars is that the game is not support full screen on my XS Max.... its a pity hope developer can fix this someday !

title.label: Really hard and keep‚Äôs getting even more challenging

content.label: I can‚Äôt even make it past the catacomb‚Äôs at this point. it start‚Äôs out easy for me to get past the mines and tower but the catacombs is just too hard and I do not like the fact they added hidden exploding mines you step on the enemies are already hard enough to kill as it is. However if you want a game to challenge you like let‚Äôs say dark souls from consoles this is the game for when you die you get to spend your gold on character upgrades which I would say is a MUST have. I like it but I really wish it could get easy enough to make it through the end.....
